results.title: Jay Jays: Cas
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This short advertisement is publicising a casual clothing company, “Jay-Jays” and its range of beach/bathing clothing modellled by young girls and guys.

results.title: Jaws [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Richard Zanuck, David Brown and Steven Spielberg
results.brief_description: A killer great white shark is creating havoc at a Long Island Beach. Facing opposition and denial from the town’s Council, the Police Chief (Roy Scheider) decides to search for, and destroy, the killer shark himself. Based on Peter Benchley’s novel, the film grabs audience attention from its opening scene to the closing credits and the suspense and terror never lets up. Skilfully edited and directed, the film set director Spielberg onto the path of fame and fortune. “Jaws” is a consummate cinematic thriller. With Richard Dreyfuss and Robert Shaw. The chilling score is by John Williams.

results.title: Jawpan
results.brief_description: Otaku and his robot friend Knowbot stumble across an evil force when out for a good time at th e”Nice Life” ATM. When the world is threatened with destruction by a “type 1 error”, Otaku and Knowbot must save the day by re-initialising planet earth.

results.title: Java: island of volcanoes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indonesia”.
Showing life in Java, the rich and varied agricultural economy, which thrives in the lush tropical climate and Djakarta, the large bustling capital city of both the island and the nation. The film also depicts the numerous volcanoes of the island and discusses their significance to the people living near them. Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: Java: island of culture
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indonesia”.
Illustrates the traditional Javanese arts of wood carving, painting, Batik dyeing, Wayang Kulit and Wayang Wong theatre as they are today, and briefly tours some of the ancient temples of the Island. Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: Jasper John: ideas in paint
results.creator_credit: Rick Tejada-Flores and WHYY Inc Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
Narrated by Polly Adams, this interesting documentary explores the paintings of Jasper Johns and follows his career from the 1950’s through to 1988. As one of the major forces on the American art scene, Johns rejected abstraction in favour of realism and layed the ground work for Pop Art and Minimalism. Featuring excerpts from interviews with Richard Serra, Hilton Kramer, Merce Cunningham, Frank Stella, John Cage and many other friends including his agent Leo Castelli, this documentary provides a broad overview of his career. The soundtrack includes readings from composer John Cage.
